MemStore

class tomem.api.memstore.MemStore(ledger_key: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Bases: tomem.api.memledger.MemLedger

Python API to store files in memory using memcached.

Uses a ledger to keep track of stored files informations such as name, size and checksum to ensure data integrity. A custom uid can be provided when storing a file, otherwise a human-readable one will be provided.

Parameters

  • ledger_key (str, optional) – Connect to an existing ledger or create one with specified key.

  • *args – Paths of files to store. A random uid will be used for each.

  • **kwargs – Paths of files to be stored with a specific uid.

flush_all() → Tuple[int, int][source]

Delete every file stored in memory.

Returns

Number of files removed and total bytes freed from memory.

Return type

tuple of int

retrieve_file(uid: str, path: str = '')[source]

Retrieve a file from memory.

Parameters

  • uid (str) – uid of the file.

  • path (str, optional) – Custom path for file creation.

Note

path must point to a directory or a non-existent file.

store_file(path: str, uid: str = '') → Tuple[str, dict][source]

Store a file in memory.

Parameters

  • path (str) – Path to the file.

  • uid (str, optional) – Specify a custom uid for the file.

Returns

rtype: (str, dict): uid of the file and record added to the ledger.

stored_files() → dict[source]

Fetch a mapping of stored files.

Returns

uid and filename for every stored file.

Return type

dict
